bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 73 (Monday, May 7, 2018)][Pages H3782-H3783]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. MOORE:H.R. 5696.[[Page H3783]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution____________________

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Nutrition.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

summary.text:
Combating Lead Poisoning Through Nutrition Education Act of 2018

This bill requires the Department of Agriculture to carry out a nutrition education program to support and award grants for community-wide messaging and outreach on: (1) the harmful impacts of lead exposure; and (2) the important role nutrition plays in a diet protective against lead exposure, especially for children.

bill.title: Combating Lead Poisoning Through Nutrition Education Act of 2018

item.title: Combating Lead Poisoning Through Nutrition Education Act of 2018

To require the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out a nutrition education program to inform the public of the sources of exposure to lead in the environment and of dietary nutrients that may reduce the harmful effects lead exposure has on health.
Combating Lead Poisoning Through Nutrition Education Act of 2018

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Nutrition.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
